p: The results of Anselin’s Local Moran’s I analysis estimated the presence of clustering of TB cases within specific suburbs and districts. Presence of clustering crudely measured the presence of active transmission. The Southern and Western suburbs had TB cases that were more likely to be clustered than the rest of Harare City (Figs 4 and 5). In 2011, there were more suburbs and districts with clustering of TB cases than 2012. Interesting to note that despite the high incidence of TB cases in the Eastern district, the cases were more dispersed and seemed to demonstrate random occurrence for both 2011 and 2012.
